body:
Here's a version of the test code that builds without... is it gstreamer headers?

[curl_test.c](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/23257901/curl_test.c)
The loop needs at least 10 laps for the problem to trigger for me.

~~~
==2222060== 
==2222060== 78,080 (73,624 direct, 4,456 indirect) bytes in 1 blocks are definitely lost in loss record 62 of 62
==2222060==    at 0x4A4B818: malloc (vg_replace_malloc.c:446)
==2222060==    by 0x406C507: my_libssh2_malloc (libssh2.c:272)
==2222060==    by 0x4136BF2: libssh2_session_init_ex (session.c:461)
==2222060==    by 0x40746E7: ssh_connect (libssh2.c:3342)
==2222060==    by 0x402DF14: protocol_connect (multi.c:1860)
==2222060==    by 0x402F443: multi_runsingle (multi.c:2493)
==2222060==    by 0x402FF97: curl_multi_perform (multi.c:2795)
==2222060==    by 0x4016FC0: handle_transfer (debugit.c:102)
==2222060==    by 0x4017401: main (debugit.c:194)

Yes it's using glib.

I'm seeing the same with 10 loops but I get it even with 1 but I'm using a remote host to connect to, don't know if that makes any difference.

Testing debug build curl via:

```
> CURL_DEBUG=multi ./src/curl -vv sftp://myserver/tmp/ --user myuser: -T test.txt
...
* [MULTI] [SHARE] [CPOOL] destroy, 1 connections
* connection #0, shutdown protocol handler (aborted=0)
* Failed to stop libssh2 sftp subsystem
* Failed to free libssh2 session: -37 would block
* [MULTI] shutdown start on connection
* [SETUP] shut down successfully
* [MULTI] [SHUTDOWN] shutdown, done=1
* [MULTI] [SHUTDOWN] closing connection #0
* [SETUP] close
* [SETUP] destroy
```

So, we try to close the SFTP subsystem, but it says it refuses. Which leaves us no choice really. The question is what is the difference to curl 8.13 here that seems to manage to avoid that.

issue.title: scp/sftp: fix disconnect

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
When a SCP/SFTP connection calls the protocol handler disconnect, it required the connections *and* the easy handles SSH meta data to be present. When the disconnect is called with an admin handle, the easy meta data is not present, which prevented the shutdown to run.

The easy meta data is however not necessary to run the shutdown state machine. Calling it with a NULL `sshp` is fine. To avoid any mixups, check `sshp` in state operations that need it.

refs #19293

body: Proposed fix in #19295. @And-yW if you could verify from your side, that'd be great.
@icing Thanks, I'm no longer seeing the memory leak.
@icing I'll see if I can get a more long term stability test running on it as well, hopefully over the weekend but otherwise next week.
Thanks. The behaviour should effectively been back to curl 8.13.0 regarding SCP/SFTP.
